title: CryptoGen65
author: CryptoGen65
content: Lately, there's been a surge of interest in $BTC driven by the upcoming US general election in November. Many presidential candidates are now showing a keen interest in the crypto community and are prepared to consider $BTC as part of the country's reserves. Check out these videos from #Bitcoin2024 to see what's been happening:https://x.com/BitcoinMagazine/status/1816950583703797993?t=F_rIPZmyti2fcV5b7CFLZQ&s=19https://x.com/Vivek4real_/status/1816934050830893316?t=F_rIPZmyti2fcV5b7CFLZQ&s=19What are your thoughts on this? Share your views.

comments.author: DubemIfedigbo001
comments.body: Trump has been positive very recently on Bitcoin, a part  of me still sees it as an election strategy. There's speculations that he's working on a bill that will see the FED hold some Bitcoin as a strategic reserve asset.If that's the case,he's elected and implements it, the bull run would be massive.

comments.author: Amphenomenon
comments.body: Meh, all these talks just to become US president, don't forget every presidential candidate will always be ready to say anything just to gain the favor of the citizens, once this is over majority won't speak about it or might even act against it and so it's like a Folk tale to them I guessed.Though this is is a good initiative but I don't know how many of these presidential candidates are actually a man/woman of their word but I think Donald Trump is one though.

Jr. also expressed support for bitcoin, who also mentioned that he would use bitcoin as a strategic reserve asset. He said this today at the bitcoin conference and we wait to see what Trump will say next. But it remains unclear because there is no guarantee that Trump will be elected or whether he will actually keep his promises. Not to mention, just because he supports it doesn't mean it will go through easily since he needs approval from Congress and the Fed. I have long doubted his idea and did not believe it would be easy to implement. I don't have too high expectations if Trump is elected, I just hope he is not as strict on bitcoin as Biden, and turning bitcoin into a reserve asset is not easy.There are only a few hours left until Trump speaks and let's see if he has anything interesting to offer.https://x.com/TheBitcoinConf/status/1817171394506953042

comments.author: Blitzboy
comments.body: This Bitcoin in the national reserves is quite interesting. Everybody is making promises during election season. Indeed, that sounds fantastic and the crypto people love it. But implementing it? That is challenging. Its not just about saying the right things, its about understanding the system, the complexities, the regulations. Its about handling the banks, the government, the whole worldwide financial machine.Bitcoin is a winner. But putting it in national reserves? That is a significant choice that must be done well and will take decades.So, listen to these politicians, hear what they have to say. But keep from getting carried away. Ask the challenging questions. Demand a true plan, not merely slogans. And most importantly consider the whole picture. This implies what for the nation, the economy, and the world generally?

comments.body: Well, I loved Robert Kennedy's speech but he is not going to win and it is much easier to deliver promises like that in that situation.And, well, Saylor at his best But we know better than to get too carried away by their enthusiasm, otherwise we would have mortgaged our house to buy bitcoin just before the last bear market.
